fields.summary: AWS JAVA SDK EC2 does not work with Eucalyptus CLC

comments.body: AWS SDK is being evaluated for 3.3; unassigning so that the ticket can be assigned to the right team

I was able to use this commit https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucalyptus/commit/dadb8ff413f8175abb02b78a86de579a8a2336a7 and the following aws java sdk branch https://github.com/sjones4/aws-sdk-java/tree/sjones4/signature-endpoint , to make it work, looks good. Look forward to more testing and 3.3.0 Eucalyptus
Let's track this in 2130 which will be delivered in 3.3

@Deependra,   

Am  having  same  problem  executing  aws  ec2  apis  on  Eucalyptus,  getting  403  error:  Login  refused.

"Status Code: 403, AWS Service: AmazonEC2, AWS Request ID: Login Failure: all modules ignored, AWS Error Code: 403 Forbidden, AWS Error Message: Login Failure: all modules ignored."

I  have  set  aws  end point  to  my(confirmed  and  working)  corp Eucalyptus  service  url: http://xx.xx.xx.xx:8773/services/Eucalyptus   and  using  correct  credentials  pair(access  key  and  secret  key).

I  could  not  understand  how  to  use  the  commit  you  have  mentioned  above.  As  an  external  corp(first  time)  Eucalyptus  user(to  invoke  amazon  ec2  apis),  could  you  tell  me  what  exact  steps  I  will  need  to  take  to  get  around  this  "Login  refused"  problem ...?  

I'm  using  Eucalyptus  version  3.2  and  aws-java-sdk  version  1.3.32 ....

Awaiting  your  quick  response  on  the  same ....
Thanks ....

Hi [~prabhatia],

If you want to use against Eucalyptus 3.2 you need to patch the AWS JAVA SDK, I think you are using the un-patched version of the AWS JAVA SDK hence it is not working.

In Eucalyptus 3.3.0 (currently under development) we have ensured that you do not need a patch for the AWS JAVA SDK and it works, currently we tested and AWS JAVA SDK 1.4.0 and 1.4.1 works!

Currently for Eucalyptus 3.2, I built a modified jar that has a patched AWS JAVA SDK 1.3.33, you can grab it from the following link, http://jeevanullas.in/tmp/aws-java-sdk-1.3.33.jar

Note that this should work but except to hit other AWS API compatibilities issues later on, some of these important issues are fixed in 3.3.0 which is due to be released in this quarter.
[~gregdek] is there anything that we're missing on this?  it should be working with 3.3.  I noticed you updated the description.  It should work with 1.4.x and 1.3.x
Closing Resolved issues for released versions of the software.
